Question Text: Which of the following properties are characteristics of virtual networks (but not necessarily characteristics of SDN). Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Separates the data and control plane.
b. Refactors network control so that network behavior is controlled from a single logically centralized controller.
c. Separates logical and physical networks.
d. Often deployed in data center networks to allow multiple tenants to share physical network infrastructure.
e. Abstracts the details of the physical network.
LLM Explanation: Virtual networks have the following characteristics:c. They separate the logical network view from the underlying physical network infrastructure. Multiple virtual networks can be overlaid on the same physical network.d. Virtual networks are commonly used in multi-tenant data centers to allow different customers (tenants) to share the same physical network hardware while maintaining isolation between their networks.e. The virtual network abstracts away the physical network details and presents a simplified logical network view to the user or application.While some virtual networks may separate the control and data planes (a) or use a centralized controller (b), these are defining characteristics of SDN but not necessarily of all virtual networks.Therefore, of the given options, c, d and e are characteristics of virtual networks but not defining characteristics of SDN.

Question Text: Which of the following are possible ways of creating virtual links in a virtual network? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. A wide-area tunnel, whereby an IP packet is encapsulated in an MPLS tunnel by attaching an MPLS header to the packet.
b. Longest-prefix match forwarding on an IP router.
c. A wide-area tunnel, whereby an Ethernet packet sent between two virtual machines is encapsulated in an IP packet.
d. VLAN switching based on a VLAN tag.
e. Pairs of virtual Ethernet interfaces, where one end of the Ethernet interface pair resides in the virtual environment, and the other resides in the root namespace on the host machine.
LLM Explanation: a. Encapsulating an IP packet in an MPLS tunnel can create a virtual link between two endpoints.b. Longest-prefix match forwarding is a standard IP forwarding mechanism and does not create virtual links.c. Encapsulating an Ethernet packet in an IP packet can create a virtual link, allowing the Ethernet packet to be tunneled across an IP network.d. VLAN switching based on VLAN tags can create virtual links by logically separating traffic on a single physical link.e. Connecting virtual Ethernet interfaces between a virtual environment and the host machine can create a virtual link, allowing the virtual machine to communicate with the host.Therefore, options a, c, d, and e are all valid ways to create virtual links in a virtual network.

Question Text: Which of the following are true of the Mininet network emulator? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. It requires running OpenFlow-capable switches.
b. It is difficult to use it to route traffic for real services.
c. Mininet only allows users to create three types of topologies: linear, tree, and single-switch topologies.
d. It can create an emulation that runs across multiple physically distributed nodes.
e. All of the hosts in the topology must run the same underlying operating system.
LLM Explanation: a. Mininet does not require running OpenFlow-capable switches. It can emulate OpenFlow switches in software.b. Mininet emulates a network on a single machine, so it is not well-suited for routing traffic for real services that need to communicate with the outside world. c. Mininet allows users to create arbitrary custom topologies, not just linear, tree, and single-switch topologies.d. Mininet runs on a single machine and cannot distribute the emulation across multiple physical nodes.e. All hosts in a Mininet topology share the same kernel and file system as the underlying host machine. So they must run the same operating system.Therefore, the correct answers are options b and e.

Question Text: What are the benefits of emulation as opposed to, say, simulation? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. An emulation will complete faster than a simulation.
b. An emulator makes it possible to "port" experiments from one machine to another.
c. An emulator allows the experimenter run real software on each of the nodes in the emulation.
d. An emulation is easier to debug than a simulation.
e. Every run of the emulator will yield exactly the same results, resulting in reproducible experiments.
LLM Explanation: a. Emulation does not necessarily run faster than simulation. In fact, emulation often runs slower because it involves running real software.b. Emulators like Mininet make it possible to package up experiments and run them on different machines. This is a key benefit.c. Running real software on emulated nodes is a key advantage of emulation over simulation. It allows testing real implementations.d. Emulation is not necessarily easier to debug than simulation. Debugging real software can be quite complex.e. Emulation does not guarantee deterministic, reproducible results like simulation can. Real software may have non-deterministic behavior.Therefore, the key benefits of emulation highlighted here are the ability to package and port experiments (b) and running real software in the emulated environment (c).

Question Text: Which of the following are possible in Mininet? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Measuring the latency between a host in San Francisco and a host in Los Angeles.
b. Assigning custom IP addresses to each node in the topology.
c. Assigning IP addresses to each node in the topology using a DHCP server.
d. Running performance measurement tools (e.g., iperf, wget) between nodes.
e. "Shaping" a link between two nodes to a particular traffic rate.
LLM Explanation: a. Mininet emulates a network on a single machine, so it cannot measure latency between geographically distant hosts.b. Mininet allows custom IP address assignment to nodes in the emulated network topology.c. Mininet does not include a DHCP server. IP addresses must be manually assigned.d. Mininet allows running various network performance measurement tools between the emulated nodes.e. Mininet supports traffic shaping on links between nodes to emulate different link speeds/qualities.Therefore, the correct answers are options b, d, and e, which are all possible in Mininet.

Question Text: Which of the following functions does FlowVisor enable? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy different load balancing applications for all traffic between the same source-destination pair.
b. Allowing two controllers to control traffic on distinct VLANs.
c. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy different Web load balancing applications for port 80 traffic.
d. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy control mechanisms for two distinct applications.
e. Allowing one controller to control TCP traffic and one controller to control UDP traffic.
LLM Explanation: FlowVisor enables network virtualization by acting as a transparent proxy between OpenFlow switches and multiple OpenFlow controllers. It allows 'slicing' the network by partitioning the flow space.a. This is not possible as the traffic between the same source-destination pair cannot be controlled by two different controllers simultaneously.b. FlowVisor can slice the network based on VLANs, allowing different controllers to manage traffic on distinct VLANs.c. FlowVisor can slice the network based on TCP/UDP port numbers, so different controllers can manage traffic for different applications (e.g., Web traffic on port 80).  d. By slicing the flow space, FlowVisor allows different controllers to implement distinct control logic for different applications.e. FlowVisor can slice the network based on transport protocol (TCP vs UDP), enabling different controllers to manage TCP and UDP traffic separately.Therefore, the correct answers are options b, c, d, and e, which are all enabled by FlowVisor's network slicing capabilities.

Question Text: Which of the following are stated applications of the Nicira Network Virtualization Platform? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Easier transition to IPv6 in data-center networks.
b. Creating more than 1024 virtual networks, as opposed to the alternative of using VLAN tags.
c. Allowing experimental protocols to coincide with a production network.
d. Central management of security policies.
e. Dynamic workload placement in multi-tenant data centers.
LLM Explanation: a. Transitioning to IPv6 is not explicitly mentioned as an application of the Nicira platform in the paper.b. The paper states that the platform can create over 16 million unique virtual networks, overcoming the 4096 VLAN limit.c. The platform allows creation of arbitrary topologies, protocols, and addressing on top of existing networks, enabling experimental protocols.d. The platform provides a central point of management for network security policies across the entire data center.e. The platform enables seamless migration of network state when workloads are dynamically placed on different physical servers.Therefore, the correct answers are options b, c, d, and e, which are all stated applications of the Nicira platform in the paper.
URLs: ['The Road to SDN: An Intellectual History of Programmable Networks by Feamster et al.']

Question Text: Select the statement that is most true about the relationship between network virtualization and SDNs.
Choices:
a. Network virtualization is a potential enabler for software-defined networks, since the separation of data and control planes first requires the creation of a logical network.
b. Software-defined networking is a potential enabler for virtual networks, since separation of data and control planes makes it easier to manage a logical network topology.
c. Network virtualization is a new concept introduced by Amazon, Nicira, and industry players; it only made sense to talk about network virtualization once central SDN controllers existed.
d. Network virtualization and software-defined networking each enable the other: SDN cannot exist without network virtualization, and network virtualization cannot exist without SDN.
LLM Explanation: Software-defined networking (SDN) is a potential enabler for virtual networks. The separation of the data plane and control plane in SDN makes it easier to manage a logical network topology, which is a key aspect of network virtualization. Network virtualization existed before SDN and does not require SDN to function. However, SDN can make network virtualization easier to implement and manage by providing a centralized control plane that can orchestrate the virtual network topology across the physical infrastructure.
